Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(2) Summary

With increasing organizational size and complexity of API landscapes, it becomes critically important to have a scalable model of how to manage APIs. When API Products are managed as self-describing products, it becomes easier to create governance models on top of this layer. Governance is about creating a viable model of how to combine oversight and autonomy without introducing bottlenecks that threaten to slow down or stifle the dynamics with which APIs can be created, published, consumed, and improved. We present an approach how through self-describing APIs, it becomes easier to balance oversight and autonomy, and how this can be done in API landscapes which are evolving quickly and across a variety of dimensions.

API Landscapes and API Portals Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(8) The Title

API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs
  • API the APIs: APIs are the only communication channel
  • Good API Governance: API management needs to be decentralized and scalable
  • Self-Describing APIs: Governance needs insight, interfaces, and nudging


API Landscapes and API Portals Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(9) The Big Picture

  • Digital Transformation needs the high velocity of API-centric architecture
  • API-centric architecture specifies its goals in an API Strategy
  • API Strategy is turned into reality by running an API Program
  • API Programs results in diverse and continuously evolving API Landscapes
  • API Landscapes need to be managed with API Management
  • API Management needs insight into APIs that …
    • … are using various design styles
    • … are implemented with a variety of technologies/tools
    • … are provided and managed on various platforms


API Landscapes and API Portals Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(10) Inside-Out vs. Outside-In



API Landscapes and API Portals Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(11) API Descriptions

  • APIs can be described in a variety of ways
    • Technical descriptions for interface mechanics (e.g., OpenAPI [https://etiketo.org/related/OpenAPI.html] and AsyncAPI [https://www.asyncapi.com/])
    • Documentation intended for human consumption
    • Metadata helping with API lifecycle management (e.g., APIs.json [https://etiketo.org/related/APIs-json.html] and schema.org [https://schema.org/WebAPI])
  • API description requirements
    • Be independent of API technology and implementation
    • Define an evolving set of well-known elements
    • Provide openness for custom additions
    • Support existing formats for backwards-compatibility
    • Build on existing patterns and specifications for description on the Web


API Landscapes and API Portals Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(14) From API to Labels



API Landscapes and API Portals Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(15) Third-Party Labels

  • Labels describe certain aspects of an API
    1. Descriptions are created and provided by API owners
    2. Descriptions are owner-created and validated by the platform
    3. Descriptions are created and provided by the platform
  • Labels support complex API governance processes
    • Processes still must be defined and implemented
    • Labels provide product-agnostic representation of descriptions
    • New tooling/products can be built on labels


Etiketo: API Labels

Outline (Etiketo: API Labels)

Etiketo: API Labels Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(17) API Label Example

  • API Labels declare information about APIs
    • APIs are identified by URI and described by label documents
    • API labels can be value labels or link labels
{
  "labels": {
    "title": "Example API"
  },
  "links": {
    "describes": "http://example.com/API"
  }
}
  • etiketo-mvp.json


Etiketo: API Labels Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(18) Etiketo API Label Format

  • API Labels in an open and extensible description framework
    • Labels can be either values or typed links
    • Labels can use a mix of registered types and extension types
    • Registered types are based on an evolving label type registry
  • Available resources for etiketo
    • etiketo.org [http://etiketo.org/] for the specification and the registry
    • etiketo validator [https://labs.xwaay.net/labels-validator] for analyzing label documents


Etiketo: API Labels Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(19) Etiketo Legacy Support 

{
  "labels": {
    "https://etiketo.org/values/APIs.json/#name": "Analysis",
    "https://etiketo.org/values/APIs.json/#description": "Provides access to blog posts and analysis across the API Evangelist network.",
    "https://etiketo.org/values/APIs.json/#image": "https://s3.amazonaws.com/kinlane-productions/api-evangelist/t-shirts/KL_InApiWeTrust-1000.png",
    "https://etiketo.org/values/APIs.json/#humanURL": "http://developer.apievangelist.com",
    "https://etiketo.org/values/APIs.json/#baseURL": "http://api.apievangelist.com/definitions/Analysis"
  },
  "links": {"describes": "http://api.apievangelist.com/definitions/Analysis"}
}
  • etiketo-apisjson.json

API Governance Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(21) Aggregating API Labels

  • API labels are integral part of API management
    • All APIs must provide or be provided with API labels
    • Crawling in the true Web sense is hard
  • API labels as part of the deployment pipeline
    • Label documents are submitted to the API platform
    • Label documents are stored/cached and archived


API Governance Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(22) Web Concepts in Etiketo

  • This API uses various Web Concepts [http://webconcepts.info]
    • HTTP Request Method [http://webconcepts.info/concepts/http-method/] GET [http://webconcepts.info/concepts/http-method/GET]
    • Media Types [http://webconcepts.info/concepts/media-type/] JSON [http://webconcepts.info/concepts/media-type/application/json] and HTTP problem reports [http://webconcepts.info/concepts/media-type/application/problem+json]
    • HTTP Status Codes [http://webconcepts.info/concepts/http-status-code/] OK [http://webconcepts.info/concepts/http-status-code/200] and Not Found [http://webconcepts.info/concepts/http-status-code/404]
{
  "labels": {
    "title": "Example API",
    "https://etiketo.org/values/webconcepts/": [
      "http://webconcepts.info/concepts/http-method/GET",
      "http://webconcepts.info/concepts/http-status-code/200",
      "http://webconcepts.info/concepts/media-type/application/json",
      "http://webconcepts.info/concepts/http-status-code/404",
      "http://webconcepts.info/concepts/media-type/application/problem+json"
    ]
  },
  "links": {"describes": "http://example.com/API"}
}
  • etiketo-webconcepts.json


API Governance Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(23) API Management

  • Labels as the first line of defense in API management
    • Use labels as a way to communicate about guidelines and compliance
    • Manage labels in the same continuous was as product delivery/deployment
    • Integrate label tests into test harnesses as a way to flag potential issues
    • Treat labels as the ground truth that platform tooling builds on


API Governance Erik Wilde (@dret): API the APIs or Good API Governance through Self-Describing APIs

(24) Labeling External APIs

  • Typical API categories supported in management models
    • Private APIs that are exposing internal capabilities
    • Partner APIs that are exposed to partners for B2B interactions
    • Public APIs for improved monetization (directly or indirectly)
  • External APIs are equally important for your API strategy
    • Manage external APIs as part of your platform
    • Describe/label external APIs like other APIs on your platform
